children.value: A typing practice that works by mapping phonemes(ish) to graphemes (or other syntactically significant units, such as braces or defuns or funcalls) to make key-emes. It solves the problem of the huge mapping table that results with compositionality: you inflict some compositional principle upon your phonemes, and get combinatorial possibilities out of 25-odd keys that you can leverage by selecting the thing that sounds vaguely right at any given time.
